column4: Why can I not copy files via Nautilus from my desktop to \usr\local\games\quake4\q4base ?
you are trying to copy somthing as a 'user' to a 'non user' area.
learn to do it with the shell and 'sudo cp    whatever  whever'
thx
make sure the dirs are allready there.
where else ya going to type it in at?
yoyu been fighting all day now to get 1 game going. :P
you have been trying to get the game installed longer then I actually Played that game
Can you help? :(
proberly not.  since i dont know exactly what yoru problem is.
is there a quake4 demo you are using? or the official one?
fire up synaptic and isntall the libsdl stuff I guess. :P

It's already installed, but there's a bug in it.  THese instructions tell me to install something as an alternative " Some Debian and Debian-based distributions ( like Ubuntu ) are crashing during startup. It appears this is caused by the SDL packages selection. You need to install libsdl1.2debian-alsa or libsdl1.2debian-oss instead of libsdl1.2debian-all. "
try apt-get install libsdl1.2debian-alsa
E: Could not get lock /var/lib/dpkg/lock - open (11 Resource temporarily unavailable)
